snippet: TISHMAN--John. The New School mourns the loss of John L. Tishman, a longtime trustee and former chair of The New School and real estate magnate who helped transform the face of the university's campus and the New York City skyline. At the helm of Tishman Realty & Construction, Mr. Tishman left his mark on a number of iconic American landmarks, from the World Trade Center and the renovation of Carnegie Hall in New York City to The John Hancock Center in Chicago and Walt Disney Company's EPCOT Center in Orlando. Serving on the board of trustees of The New School from 1981 until his death and also as chairman of the board from 1995 until 2001, Mr. Tishman generously led the way for the creation of several key projects at the university, including the Tishman Environment and Design Center and the University Center. His vision and leadership made a profound impact on The New School and his legacy will live on to benefit generations of students. We extend our condolences to the Tishman family, including his son, Daniel, and his daughter-in-law, Sheryl Crockett Tishman; his daughter, Katherine Blacklock; and his three grandchildren. 1/3
